name: New York
hint: The Big Apple, America's most populous city with iconic skyscrapers

name: Los Angeles
hint: City of Angels, home to Hollywood and the entertainment industry

name: Chicago
hint: The Windy City on Lake Michigan, known for deep-dish pizza

name: Toronto
hint: Canada's largest city, home to the CN Tower on Lake Ontario

name: Mexico City
hint: Capital of Mexico, built on the ruins of the Aztec capital Tenochtitlan

name: Vancouver
hint: Coastal city in British Columbia, surrounded by mountains and ocean

name: Washington DC
hint: Capital of the United States, home to the White House and Capitol

name: Houston
hint: Largest city in Texas, home to NASA's Mission Control

name: Montreal
hint: Largest French-speaking city in North America, in Quebec

name: Havana
hint: Capital of Cuba, famous for classic cars and colonial architecture

name: San Francisco
hint: City by the Bay, known for the Golden Gate Bridge and cable cars

name: Miami
hint: Tropical city in southern Florida, gateway to Latin America

name: Seattle
hint: Pacific Northwest city known for the Space Needle, coffee culture, and tech industry

name: Boston
hint: Historic New England city, home to Harvard and MIT nearby

name: Atlanta
hint: Capital of Georgia, a major hub of the American South and civil rights history

name: Phoenix
hint: Capital of Arizona, one of the hottest cities in the United States

name: Guadalajara
hint: Mexico's second-largest city, birthplace of mariachi and tequila

name: Monterrey
hint: Industrial capital of northern Mexico, surrounded by dramatic mountains

name: Panama City
hint: Capital of Panama, located at the Pacific entrance of the famous canal

name: Santo Domingo
hint: Capital of the Dominican Republic, oldest continuously inhabited European settlement in the Americas
